intro: Pleocnemia andaiensis, commonly known as the Andean pleocnemia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
